intro: Cottendorfia albicans, commonly known as the white cottendorf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is the white, fluffy flower heads that resemble small clouds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
